panels.description: Error rates are a measure of unhandled service exceptions per second. Client errors are excluded when possible. Lower is better

seriesOverrides.alias: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

targets.legendFormat: 6h Degradation SLO (5% of monthly error budget)
1h Outage SLO (2% of monthly error budget)

panels.title: plantuml Service Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="plantuml"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_5m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="plantuml"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="plantuml"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_1h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="plantuml"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="plantuml"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_30m{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="plantuml"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="plantuml"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_service_errors:ratio_6h{env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="plantuml"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="",monitor="global",type="plantuml"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.description: The operation rate is the sum total of all requests being handle for all components within this service. Note that a single user request can lead to requests to multiple components. Higher is busier.
panels.title: plantuml Service RPS - Requests per Second

panels.description: Saturation is a measure of what ratio of a finite resource is currently being utilized. Lower is better.
panels.title: Saturation

panels.title: loadbalancer SLI Error Ratio

targets.expr:
sum (
  label_replace(
    vector(0) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="loadbalancer",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="plantuml"}),
    "period", "na", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(1) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_5m{component="loadbalancer",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="plantuml"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="loadbalancer",monitor="global",type="plantuml"})),
    "period", "5m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(2) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_1h{component="loadbalancer",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="plantuml"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (14.4 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="loadbalancer",monitor="global",type="plantuml"})),
    "period", "1h", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(4) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_30m{component="loadbalancer",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="plantuml"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="loadbalancer",monitor="global",type="plantuml"})),
    "period", "30m", "", ""
  )
  or
  label_replace(
    vector(8) and on() (gitlab_component_errors:ratio_6h{component="loadbalancer",env="$environment",environment="$environment",monitor="global",type="plantuml"} > on(tier, type) group_left() (6 * slo:max:events:gitlab_service_errors:ratio{component="loadbalancer",monitor="global",type="plantuml"})),
    "period", "6h", "", ""
  )
)

panels.content:
### Observability Tools

* [Google Load Balancer](https://console.cloud.google.com/net-services/loadbalancing/details/http/k8s-um-plantuml-plantuml--58df01f69d082883?project=gitlab-production)
* [Stackdriver Logs: Loadbalancer Access Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=resource%2Elabels%2Eurl%5Fmap%5Fname%3D%22k8s%2Dum%2Dplantuml%2Dplantuml%2D%2D58df01f69d082883%22%0Aresource%2Etype%3D%22http%5Fload%5Fbalancer%22;timeRange=PT30M?project=gitlab-production)
* [Stackdriver Logs: Loadbalancer Access 5xx Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=httpRequest%2Estatus%3E%3D500%0Aresource%2Elabels%2Eurl%5Fmap%5Fname%3D%22k8s%2Dum%2Dplantuml%2Dplantuml%2D%2D58df01f69d082883%22%0Aresource%2Etype%3D%22http%5Fload%5Fbalancer%22;timeRange=PT30M?project=gitlab-production)
* [Stackdriver Nginx Access Logs](https://console.cloud.google.com/logs/query;query=resource%2Elabels%2Enamespace%5Fname%3D%22plantuml%22%0Aresource%2Etype%3D%22k8s%5Fcontainer%22;timeRange=PT30M?project=gitlab-production)
panels.title: Details

panels.description:
Kubernetes containers are allocated a share of CPU. When this is exhausted, the container may be thottled.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      sum by (environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
        rate(container_cpu_usage_seconds_total:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="plantuml"}[5m])
      )
      /
      sum by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, pod, container) (
        container_spec_cpu_quota:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="plantuml"}
        /
        container_spec_cpu_period:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="plantuml"}
      )
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_cpu component saturation: Kube Container CPU Utilization

panels.description:
This uses the working set size from cAdvisor for the cgroup's memory usage. That may
not be a good measure as it includes filesystem cache pages that are not necessarily
attributable to the application inside the cgroup, and are permitted to be evicted
instead of being OOM killed.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      container_memory_working_set_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="plantuml"}
      /
      (container_spec_memory_limit_bytes:labeled{container!="", container!="POD", env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="plantuml"} > 0)
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_container_memory component saturation: Kube Container Memory Utilization

panels.description:
The [Horizontal Pod Autoscaler](https://kubernetes.io/docs/tasks/run-application/horizontal-pod-autoscale/)
automatically scales the number of Pods in a deployment based on metrics.

The Horizontal Pod Autoscaler has a configured upper maximum. When this
limit is reached, the HPA will not increase the number of pods and other
resource saturation (eg, CPU, memory) may occur.
 Lower is better.

targets.expr:
clamp_min(
  clamp_max(
    max by(environment, tier, type, stage, shard, horizontalpodautoscaler, shard) (
  clamp_min(
    clamp_max(
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_status_desired_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="plantuml", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|urgent-authorized-projects|urgent-other", namespace!~"pubsubbeat"}
      /
      kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_spec_max_replicas:labeled{env="$environment",environment="$environment",type="plantuml", shard!~"database-throttled|elasticsearch|gitaly-throttled|urgent-authorized-projects|urgent-other", namespace!~"pubsubbeat"}
      ,
      1)
  ,
  0)
)

  ,1)
,0)

panels.title: kube_horizontalpodautoscaler_desired_replicas component saturation: Horizontal Pod Autoscaler Desired Replicas

panels.description:
Open file descriptor utilization per instance.

Saturation on file descriptor limits may indicate a resource-descriptor leak in the application.

As a temporary fix, you may want to consider restarting the affected process.
 Lower is better.
panels.title: open_fds component saturation: Open file descriptor utilization per instance
